turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Sorry you had to see that. You were saying?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I was saying that it seems probable that she witnessed the murder, but her memory of it is gone, at least for the time being. I also think you ought to have her stay with someone tonight.  Any idea who Chloe or Lonnie are?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: No... Friends from the diner maybe?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well, you should find out. She keeps talking about them...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hey, Sheriff. How's everything?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Oh, you know, the usual... keeping the world safe.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...I meant your food.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Oh, right... 's fine. Thanks.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm in a motel. Has something happened to Del? Did he do something stupid?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: BETTY, I NEED TO TALK TO YOU... IN PERSON! WHERE'RE YOU AT?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: IF THIS IS ABOUT DEL, FORGET IT! I'M NOT COMING BACK!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: GODAMMIT, BETTY!... WHO'S CHLOE?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'M THROUGH TALKING NOW! GOODBYE!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sheriff, I don't...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: C'mon, Betty, open up! I got some questions for you about...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Yeah, it was great. Really put the whole idea of "church bake sales" in perspective...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You know, Elden, some people actually read more than just the Classifieds...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Why don't you go back to doing something you're good at... like that Lonelyhearts column?  I'll take a refill there, Betty...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I thought you said the eggs weren't...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: It's fine. Mind your own meal...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You should get the order you want.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: And you should keep your nose out of another man's omelette...  It's no big deal, Betty.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Why you always gotta embarrass me? I been eating lunch with you since grade school and you always gotta embarrass me!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: They're just eggs, Elden, how embarrassing can eggs be?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: ...plenty

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Who eats eggs for lunch, anyhow?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Mind your own business. You just said that shit so you could look at her a little longer, anyway...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Okay, let's go... I got nothing for the record yet.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oww! My arm, careful!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Ahh, what'd you do now... fall off your bike again?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: No, it's nothing, I... my piranha just mauled me a little when I layed their food out.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Good God... they're meat eaters, Roy, just drop the shit in there!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I can't... they prefer a more formal presentation. I don't usually go so close to the surface, but I was...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: ...you are so goddamn weird.  Oh, and by the way, get the hell outta here!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: No, Elden, I need to...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You need to get yourself gone from my crime scene. And leave Betty alone, she's...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: She knows who killed Del. Elden, she said it was a woman.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: It wasn't a woman.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Yes it was. Betty saw the whole thing! Your killer's name is Chloe...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I'm tellin' you it wasn't no woman, Roy!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You think a woman did that?!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: So, you think you're gonna find his scalp hanging in some tepee?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: They no longer live in tepees, Mr. College Graduate.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Did you send anyone out there?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You bet I did. I got a squad car on the way to the reservation right now.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Bad idea...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You just go write your little story, Roy. I'll handle the police work...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You better handle what's in this garbage can first.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I questioned Joyce about all this...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Seems she was pretty familiar with 'ol Del. On a regular basis, if you get my drift...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: ...and half the other guys in this town. Including you, I believe...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Junior year!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Anyway, so what?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: So? ...Suppose Betty found out about them?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You said a woman couldn't have done it.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: A woman can write a check.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: So you're saying Betty Sizemore -- our Betty Sizemore -- who you were in swing choir with -- has now hired somebody to scalp her husband in her own kitchen while she watched? You're amazing.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: 'S just a theory... just 'cause I'm thinking it don't mean I like it.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oh, you're sharp as a tack, Elden.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: That's it! YOU'RE GONE!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oww, the arm, the arm!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You just don't know when to quit, Roy! You were jealous of me when I got hall monitor in seventh grade, and you're still jealous now!!!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: One question, Doctor, please!  You can't do this! I'm the press, I have rights!!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: That's right, you have the right to remain silent.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: What if the killers didn't see her? You published her picture -- you're gonna get her killed!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: No, we're bringing the community into the effort to find her.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You're lying!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I spoke to Betty Sizemore yesterday.  That's right. There's no doubt in my mind, folks... she's on the run. Whether or not she's mixed up in all this remains to be seen...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: That's bullshit, Sheriff! You think she's a suspect!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I'd like to apologize for our local boy. He's been in love with Betty since the fifth grade, y'see. He means well, but he's in over his head on this.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: What the hell do you want?... Hey, Sue Ann, what's up?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: We think we know where Betty is.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Ah, shit... Do I have to hear this now?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I see you're sticking to the diet Betty put you on...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Worry about your own goddamn lunch!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Tell him what you told me.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Why do I need to see this? Did he ask you to...?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Listen! I saw 'Chloe' and 'Lonnie' on T.V. They're television characters.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Yeah? Well, she called Sue Ann yesterday from Arizona.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: She said she was in Arizona, did she?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Come on, Elden, think about it. The driver, all them trunks standing open like that... something's going on here!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I know that...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Well, do something, then, damnit!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You watch your mouth when you're in a goddamn county vehicle... You don't think I see what's going on? Del, now this Cooley fella, both of 'em mixed up with Joyce... 'S not no conspiracy, not some episode off the X-Files... 's just a crime of passion, plain and simple. Betty's on some kind'a pre-minstral rampage, that's what is going on here.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oww... Did you have to make these things so tight?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: No, I didn't have to.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Elden, let me out of here. Now! This is ridiculous, I need medical attention!

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: That's a nice name for what you need...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Come on, I have to get this dressing off... it itches! And what about my fish? Who is taking care of them?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Just shut up a second and listen... That, uh... that bar in Arizona? Where you said Betty was?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Any idea where it is?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Little place called "Williams," why?

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: I just got something off the wire. The woman who owns it was murdered last night.  Now, I'm not saying I agree with you or nothing, but... what else do you know?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I know plenty.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: That's a lie! I figured it out! I've been trying to tell this dumbass --

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Fuck you, Roy Ostrey!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: -- small-time, pissant, Barney Fife --

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: We're in a shootout, Roy! Shut up about the damn fish!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: YOU shut up!  They're beautiful, but get them some water.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: We need ammo... Go check his jacket, I'll cover you.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I'm not going out there! Let's wait for the real police...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: You gotta go, we're pinned down!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You wanna see if he has more shells, go ahead. I say we wait...

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: No, no, no... you don't know shit about procedure! You don't send your best...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I've got the working gun, Elden, me! You wasted all your bullets so you crawl out there.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Uhh, no, we haven't picked a date yet... well, once he dumps her we will.  He's out pricing banners... I don't expect him back.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "Banners?"

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: You know, flags and shit... he said "for a livelier look" or something.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Need something else?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, I was just... How you doing?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Great. Good. Content...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh. How come?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: I dunno. Job satisfaction, I guess...  How's things at the Tip Top?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They're fine... you miss it?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: You must be joking.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hmm.  So, Del get that car he sold you up and running yet?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, he's got things up and running, alright...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: 'Kay, good. Bye, then...

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Anyway, I'm thinking Easter, 'cause I just fucking love pastels.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Who are these idiots?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: This is Roy Ostrey, he's a reporter. And this is Sheriff Ballard. We all went to Fair Oaks High together...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh, this is wonderful...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...I s'pose you did that so I could take my sweater off or something.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, just stand there... lemme look at you a minute.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Do you know who I am?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...I... I know what you are.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Do you know why I'm here?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I've got a pretty good idea. You're here to kill me, so kill me. You want me to be afraid, but I'm not. I don't care who you are, or why you two killed my husband...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You really... didn't have anything to do with what Del was doing, did you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I have no idea what he was mixed up in... it was always something.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So you weren't involved with him in his pathetic attempt to diversify?  Were you mixed up in the drugs, Betty?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Drugs? God, no! I'm totally against drugs.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Damn, life is strange. I had you figured for this cold-blooded, calculating bitch -- Not that I didn't admire you for it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...well, if you're not going to slit my throat, why'd you come up here?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...to see you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...I never meet people like you. I'm a garbageman of the human condition. I deal with trash, mostly, people willing to trade any part of themselves for a few more minutes of their rotten lives. But you... you're different.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Sure. You could probably have any thing you wanted... somebody as beautiful and stylish as yourself, and you don't even realize it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm appreciably older than you, but my health is good. I take care of myself, and I got some money socked away. You'd never have to work again, that's for sure. I'd treat you like a queen.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Umm, I don't think that...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wait. Let me get this out.  I like the symphony, walks in the rain, sunsets, animals and children. I read passionately, and I like to discuss things. I'm basically conservative, but flexible. I've been involved in the death of thirty- two people, but I can live with that because the world is lighter by thirty- two pieces of shit, excuse my language.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "Thirty-two?"

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, thirty-three, but I'm not counting Del, on account of you... so, what do you think?  You probably feel I'm flattering myself to see us together.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't feel that, no. I just... I'm not really who you think I am.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No one is, honey. Here, listen to this... "If who I am and who I hope to be should meet one day, I know they will be friends." Now that's beautiful.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I wrote that when I was twelve... where'd you get that?!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I know. I borrowed it from your grandparents because I... I... it doesn't matter. Don't worry, they're fine...  Look, I used to feel that same way, said practically those same words, sitting at night in a foxhole in Korea...  I've chased you across the country, Betty, and I come to find out we're a lot more alike than you'd think.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I thought you were a garbageman of humanity, or something.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes, but I'd sort of like to put that behind me now...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's my son! My son is dead!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're sorry? YOU'RE THE REASON WE'RE HERE!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: WAIT A SECOND! I AM NOT THE REASON YOU'RE HERE! I WAS MINDING MY OWN BUSINESS, LIVING A PERFECTLY BORING LIFE UNTIL YOU CAME ALONG!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: If we went out that window right now we'd have a chance...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I better go check on them.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wait, Betty... you still haven't answered me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: This is really awkward...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ahh, it's too late, anyway. It's too late.  Listen, I could shoot my way out, maybe take one of them with me... If you'd gimme my gun back.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'd rather not...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Betty, I don't wanna shrivel up alone in some stinking prison. No way. I've got some professional pride. And I don't want anybody else to get the credit for taking me out.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...what're you saying?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: When a Roman general knew a battle was lost, he'd throw himself on his sword.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Did... did you really come here because you love this guy?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes... Not the actor, though, the doctor. I think.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So all this... really was because of that soap opera? My son is dead because you came out here to be with that doctor? A fake doctor?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I wouldn't have put it quite that way, but...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wesley didn't even want to come up here. He warned me, but I insisted...  I have to ask you, Betty...are you crazy?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't think I am.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: Of course, I don't know every doctor who works here...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Dr. Ravell's the finest surgeon on the staff. You must know him. He's incredibly handsome, gentle, considerate. He's being sued for sexual assault right now, but --  It's not true. He was set up.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: Well, I certainly would have heard about that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Of course, he's only here two days a week. He's also on staff over at Loma Vista.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: ...I don't think I know that hospital.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's in a very pretty area that gets a lot of sun, has palm trees out front, mountains in the background...

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: Really? You've just described all of Southern California.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: What you did yesterday was reckless at best. You are not an employee of this hospital! If that boy dies I don't even want to think of the lawsuit that'll follow. Are we communicating here?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: Good. I'm prepared to offer you a job. You can help out in the pharmacy until your California certification and references arrive, but you are not to touch anyone. Is that totally clear?  Fine...

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: You can start tomorrow. And don't say a word about this to anyone.  Is that issue?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Umm... yes. Back home.

turns.speaker: CHIEF NURSE
turns.text: Alright. Oh, and one more thing about what you did yesterday... Well done.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Did you watch it yet?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Sure did. I'll tell you, if that man was any better looking it'd be a crime 'a some sort...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yep. Hey, I got a surprise for tonight. We're going to the Starlite in style!

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Oh, Betty --

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'll give you a hint. If you scrunch up your eyes a bit it looks just like a Jaguar...

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Honey, I'm really sorry, I was gonna call you about tonight. Larry's got a lodge meeting. There's no way I can get a sitter this fast.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No... what about your sister?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: I can't ask her again -- Nathan, stop it! Jesse, don't take that, hit back! -- I feel terrible, hon.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: You sure? Maybe next week we could...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Uh-huh. No, we'll do it later. 'S only a birthday, right? I'll have another one next year...

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Aahhh...  So what color is it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: The LeSabre!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Maroon.  I stole it.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He wasn't going to let us use it, so I just took it.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Oh, I wish we could just get in it and drive, and drive, and drive!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yeah, me too.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Sorry, hon. Happy Birthday...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I gotta go make dinner.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Let me know if you need anything, okay?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Are you and Larry happy?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Oh, I dunno... enough, I s'pose.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Then you should treasure that... you gotta hold on to whatever you got that's any good, even if it's only a little bit.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: All you been through... I ever tell you what a good friend you are?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: All the time...

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Well, you are.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Something bad happened to Del and me, didn't it?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Yeah, hon. Real bad. You just get some sleep, everything's gonna be fine.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sue Ann, I'm sorry about all this, but I just know there's something special out there for me...

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Halfway where? You've gotta come home. We've been worried sick about you. Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sue Ann, I thought you of all people would back me up on this, you know what Del's like. How did he take my note?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Betty, honey, listen to me. A man came by from Mutual Life Insurance. He says you've got money comin' to you from Del's policy.  Del's life insurance policy -- Are you with me?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Tell Del I'm sorry. I left so quick, but I need to do this.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I gotta go.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Betty! Listen to me! Del is ...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...of course you do.  You don't remember me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I take it I should. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: We were engaged.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But I'm the one who's sorry. Letting you go was the biggest mistake of my life.  We were thirteen days away from getting married and... I just got scared. It's a mistake I've had to live with for six years. But it's behind me now...  And I hope you can put it behind you. I've missed you... David.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's very kind of you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The day I left you I just drove and drove. I drove all day and all that night, and I didn't go anywhere. I just kept driving. I stopped at a little country church, and the pastor let me in, and I sat --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, you mean Fred.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, Del.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Right, Del. Del was one hot salesman. Of cars. He could talk anyone into anything.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You knew Del?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Honey, I didn't want to tell you at the time, but Del and I go way back. We went to school together. In fact, he saved my life. Two more minutes in that icy water and I would have drowned. But Del jumped in and grabbed me. We fell out of touch eventually, but I still owe him one.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He never told me anything about... that's unbelievable!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I tried to tell myself it was for the best, that there was a reason behind it. But... Del?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There was no plan! I was just young and stupid and scared!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You never gave us a chance...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know that. I can't tell you how many times I've said that to myself in those exact words.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why do they keep calling you George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know. Why do you keep calling me George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I guess we all did.  You know, I didn't marry Leslie because I loved her. I married her to forget you...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, David... I'm sorry I caused you that much pain.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh my God! What's Lonnie doing here?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're late, Eric.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Lyla's very nice.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes, she is.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: She told me I was charming and relentless, and would go far in this town. And she said that unlike the other charming, relentless people she knew, she liked me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's a good person to know.  So where did you study again?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Carleton School of Nursing. Two semesters, but Del made me give it up...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Alright, okay... I think you broke the record for staying in character about three hours ago.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You told me that two hours ago.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I haven't been this happy since I was twelve years old.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What happened when you were twelve?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: For Mother's Day, I used all my allowance that I'd been saving to take my mother to Kansas City. We got our nails done and had lunch at "Skies," a restaurant at the top of a building from where you can see the whole city. It was the last outing we took together. She died the following year.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Wow... You just gave me goosebumps, you know that? You make it all sound so real. Great improv...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I just want everything to be perfect between us.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I know. Listen, we need to take a time out here. Can we talk seriously for a minute?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: At last! I know how much you want this. You're gifted and extremely determined, but... it's not up to me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know. It's up to us.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't think your friend likes me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: She's a little jealous, I think. And confused when it comes to men...  So where are we going?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, first I thought Patina, and then the Ivy, but then I thought of somewhere a little more romantic. Like my place.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You never mentioned a 'Stella' to me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Didn't I?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, I would have remembered that name. The only Stella I ever knew was a parrot.  Was this before Leslie? Before us?...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've never met anyone like you, Betty.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know, that's why we were meant to be together...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, I mean your dedication scares me...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's easy to be dedicated, when you care about something...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, I felt that way, too, when I first started, but now... the hours, the repetition... it's not all glamour and mall openings anymore. Maybe I should've listened to my people and tried to make the crossover to nights earlier, I don't know...  ...I just hope it's not too late for me. God! Listen to me, "Me, me, me." It's so easy to get caught up in the whole ego cycle of this business and make it all about yourself. Stop, right? That's it, no more about me tonight, I promise... Let's talk about you... what do you think about me? I'm kidding... Seriously, Betty, I'm doing all the talking here...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...but I love listening to you, so that's okay...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thanks. But I'd like to hear what you're feeling...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well, I just feel that life'll be much sweeter for you now with me around. I promise...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You know, I almost believe that... you're like a warm breeze that's suddenly blown into my life...  I said that to Leslie, once, at her funeral, remember?...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I remember. You said it to her, but it was meant for me, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes... maybe it was.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Your lines are in the script, but you can ad lib.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ad lib?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: In fact, I want you to ad lib, that's the magic I'm after. I wanna give a whole new feel to the show.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: David, I don't... Can we talk privately for a second?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Stop calling me David. We're on set, for Christ's sake, you don't have to call me David here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why am I doing this to you? Isn't this what you wanted?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, I don't know what you had in mind, but I hope you're happy. I put myself on the line for you, my reputation, and you're making me look like an idiot.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What do you mean? What did I do to you...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Who put you up to this? Did my ex- wife ask you to...?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: David, please --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: STOP CALLING ME THAT! MY NAME IS NOT DAVID, AND IF YOU REALLY DON'T KNOW THE DIFFERENCE, YOU'RE MORE FUCKED UP THAN I THOUGHT YOU WERE!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry... Oh my gosh, are you George McCord?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: ...What? What did you call me? George... McCord. You're my favorite actor on...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But I'm David... I mean, I'm not David, but she thinks I am! You heard her...  Stop staring at me... I'm not crazy, she is!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why are you screaming at me? I mean, what am I... why am I here? I don't...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're doing this now? After all the... are you sick? Are you going to kill me now?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, I... I'll leave. Forgive me if I caused you all any trouble... I just, I don't know how I...  ...I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh. Of course... sorry.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: My treat. You were saying... something about how stupid you've been?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Right... I was. I was an idiot, plain and simple, and I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me. How's that?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Kinda like you'd been saying it since you got on the plane...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I have... did it sound that bad?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Mmm-hmm. Listen, I forgive you, Mr. McCord...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: George...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...George. I do.  My best friend once said if you were any handsomer it would be a crime...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thanks...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...it's too bad you're such an asshole. 'S the only thing that Del was ever right about.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: So, call me when you --

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hang on a second there, baby. Why do you need one of the new Buicks?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, you're there. You sound out of breath.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: I ran back in to get the phone.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't need one, but it's kind of a special night, and --

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: What's so special about it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Nothing... it's, ahh, busy here. Look, you don't need a LeSabre to go out with Sue Ann. Take the blue Corsica. I'll see you when I get home.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sure you don't want any salad?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: No, I do not want any goddamn... what was all that shit on the phone about the new Buicks?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I told you. Sue Ann was gonna take me out tonight, but...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: She's not comfortable in a Corsica? 'S got air and leather...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I took the blue Corsica, Del. Relax.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: All right, then. Actually, I'm glad you're going out. I got something going on tonight. Some serious clients, with real potential.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...like the water purifiers?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Or the vitamins? Or the...?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Hey, the FDA screwed me on that when they changed the law, and you know it!  Anyway, 'least I try shit, still got some dreams left... you're a goddamn waitress, what do you got?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I got you, Del...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: ...well, then you ain't got much.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, I know.  So, who're these clients?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Couple 'a guys in from outta town. They want to see the new LeSabres.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: And I don't need Sue Ann's fat ass around to fuck it up...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Just knock it off, 'kay? Anyhow, they're 97's, they're not even new.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: They're new to us...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: It's people with no lives watching other people's fake lives.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess there's nothing like watching those tenpins fall, huh, Del?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: That is a skill!

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Well, are you gonna answer me? What'd you come here for?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I came for love...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: You're not on that soap opera thing again, are you? 'Cause you know what that is?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's people with no lives watching other people's fake lives.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: That's right. So, if you know it, why are you in trouble?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: You sure don't. Who do you think you are coming to Hollywood, anyway? You should remember where you came from. And who you really are.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Hi, Betty. You're looking good...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thanks, Roy, you're sweet... a big liar, but sweet. I liked your editorial this morning...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oh, appreciate it. I was trying to, ahh, give a sense of history to...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Hey, Betty. Are you okay?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm great, good, content.  What happened to your arm, Roy?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Oh, nothing, it's fine. I just need to keep it wrapped for a few...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Make sure it's elevated...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You want me to make you a sling? It's no problem...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What're you doing here, Roy?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Well, I was worried about you and I wanted to make sure you were alright... and I guess I was sort of hoping I could ask you about what happened...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, that... Sure, I saw the whole thing. It was disgusting!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: My God... did you get a look at who did it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You did? Was it anyone that you...?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It was Chloe...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Betty! Boy, am I glad to see you!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Roy! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You're in serious danger!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ahh, look, right now's not very...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I woulda' been here sooner, but Ballard put me in jail. He still thinks you had Del scalped.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Have you checked the trunk of that car you're driving, Betty? I think there might be...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's not really a good time, guys...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What's the matter here?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I begged him to let me put that on!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: He's a prick. Merle?... You're a prick.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: So you're into "Reason," too? Finally, someone civilized! I'm Ellen, what can I get you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hi, I'm Betty. I'll take a Miller, if you got it...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Shut up, Merle... Williams.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Williams, Arizona. About halfway there, I guess.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: If that little weasel ever walked in here I wouldn't serve him.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'd slap his face.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I'd kick him in the nuts, if I thought he had any.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Where you headed, Betty?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Los Angeles, California.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: And you called your friend, and she's telling you not to go?  When I went to Europe my friends told me I was crazy.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Europe? The Europe?  This is my first time out of Kansas.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I should call you Dorothy.  When I left here I went straight to Italy. Everybody told me not to go. But I wanted to go to Rome ever since I saw Audrey Hepburn in "Roman Holiday," and goddamnit, I went.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Did you love it?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Sure I loved it! It was great.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Let me tell you something. I got groped by these Tunisian guys who thought I was a slut for wearing shorts, it was hotter than stink the whole time, and I got some kind of weird gum disease from the water. Plus, it ended my marriage --

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That's horrible!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: No, he was a toad. Even more of a toad than Merle... I just wear the ring to keep the flies away. Rome was the best thing I ever did, because I DID IT! And I swear to you, it changed me. I've been to Rome, Italy! I sat every morning at the Cafe Sistina and had my cappuccino, and watched the pilgrims walk to mass, and no one can ever take that away from me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I left my husband two days ago.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm getting back with my ex-fianc. He proposed to me right around here, so I guess this is just sort of a sentimental stop...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Wait, I thought you said you'd never been outta Kansas...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh. I mean, except for that.  Yep. I'm trading in a car dealer for a heart specialist, so that's pretty good...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Nice move. Cedars Sinai?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No. Loma Vista.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I s'pose his name's David Ravell.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What's his real name?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Dr. David Ravell.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You mean... George McCord, the actor?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, I mean David Ravell. He's a surgeon.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Piss off, Merle.  So how you gonna find him, Betty?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'll go to the Hospital.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What if you can't find him? What if you get out there, and nothing's the way you thought it was gonna be?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Like Rome?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Worse.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You made out alright.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Yeah, but at least I knew Rome was gonna be there when I arrived...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ellen, this is the biggest thing I've ever done, but I've gotta do it.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You take care of yourself then, Betty, and don't let anybody stop you...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: To tell you the truth, I can't believe I've made it this far. It may not be Europe, but I just know there's something special out there for me...

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I can't believe I remembered that, although I suppose I should. I wrote it...  But that was seven years ago, and you're quoting it verbatim. I'm flattered... I think. Or frightened. What's your name?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Betty Sizemore. What do you mean you wrote it?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I'm Lyla Branch. I'm the Producer.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well, David moved out here and started his residency. Then he met Leslie --

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: No, no, no. We know all that. What happened with you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I married a car salesman.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: She called you 'George,' George.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...did I win some contest?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He has no heartbeat!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You're hurting him!!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm massaging his heart. I saw it done once.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: ARE YOU CRAZY?!! STOP IT!!!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: LISTEN TO ME! IF I DON'T DO THIS, HE'S DEAD!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You don't sound like you're from here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm not. I just drove in from Kansas.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: So why'd you come to L.A.?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I came for love. My fianc is here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's something I had to do. For David.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: 'David.' That's your guy. So, you staying with him?
